b"RT @mikegoodma: Fambrough in an Evercore ISI interview said about the HBV program that there's not much differentiation among RNAi drugs \xe2\x80\x93\xe2\x80\xa6"

b'2006 jointly Andrew Fire and Craig Mello won Noble Prize for RNA interference. The 1st drug was approved in 2018.  In between there was a rise, collapse, and rise in valuations $ALNY $DRNA $ARWR.  Shall we see the same with CRSPR $CRSP $NTLA $EDIT $BEAM?'

b'Fambrough also says that key features of an HBV combo are 1. an agent that attacks viral production; 2. an agent that reduces S antigen; & probably an agent that helps stimulate the immune system. Roche has several HBV combo agents in its pipeline: TLR7 agonist, CpAM, etc. $DRNA'

b"Fambrough in an Evercore ISI interview said about the HBV program that there's not much differentiation among RNAi drugs \xe2\x80\x93 differentiation will come from combos which are \xe2\x80\x9cthe next phase.\xe2\x80\x9d Roche +  $DRNA will kick off HBV combos in early 2021."
